oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of mycorrhiza and plant growth promoting rhizobacteria inoculants on rice crops in Northern India
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Srivastava, Rashmi
Berset, Estelle
Mäder, Paul
Adholeya, Alok
Padruot, Fried
Sharma, Anil K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
India
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mutualistic root microorganisms such as arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi (AMF) and plant growth promoting rhizobacteria (PGPR) can ameliorate plant nutrition through an extended extra-radical hyphal network and by nutrient mobilisation. Running under the Indo-Swiss Collaboration in Biotechnology (ISCB), our project focuses on the integration of AMF and PGPR as biofertilisers in wheat-rice and wheat-black gram systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Srivastava, Rashmi; Berset, Estelle; Mäder, Paul; Adholeya, Alok; Padruot, Fried and Sharma, Anil K. (2011) Effects of mycorrhiza and plant growth promoting rhizobacteria inoculants on rice crops in Northern India. In: Becker, Mathias; Kreye, Christine; Ripken, Christina and Tielkes, Eric (Eds.) Tropentag 2011 - Development on the margin - Book of abstracts, DITSL GmbH, Witzenhausen, Germany, p. 206.
